title: Conservation of energy - moving block up ramp

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m equals 0.2 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> on a ramp with negligible friction is pressed against a spring with spring constant <math alttext="k equals 800 newtons per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math>, compressing it a distance <math alttext="delta x equals 0.1 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Î”</mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math>. The block is then released and travels up the ramp. What is the height of the block above its initial height when it has speed <math alttext="v equals 5.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="2.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="3.25 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
